sub_title: Aerospace Research Engineer for SJSURF @ NASA Ames | TU Delft | Co-Founder 180DC Delft-Rotterdam | Holland in the Valley Fellow and ASML scholar
summary:
International and competitive aerospace engineer that strives to learn as much as possible and whose main concern is contributing to a smarter and more sustainable future. 

Always seeking challenges that would broaden my mindset and would help me to grow as a professional and as a person. Social and open-minded who loves travelling, discovering different cultures and meeting new people in order to have a global perspective of the world around us. 

Very dynamic, confident and pro-active engineer, who believes time management and determination are key for achieving one’s dreams.

awards.title: Dutch2USA Internship Grant
awards.description: Grant worth 7400 dollars awarded by The Netherland-America Foundation for high-achieving Dutch students looking to pursue professional internships in the US.

awards.title: Holland in the Valley Fellow
awards.description: Awarded by Internships in the Valley (https://internshipsinthevalley.org/about), a talent program of the Dutch Consulate General in San Francisco and 13 Dutch research universities that aims at helping the best students in Dutch universities to obtain an internship in Silicon Valley. From over 800 applicants, I have been selected for the 2022 cohort. This program has guided me through the J-1 visa procedure, prepared me for life and work in the US, and supported me with a social program during my stay.

awards.title: Cum Laude
awards.description:
A student can receive the designation “Cum Laude” for the Bachelor’s degree audit if the Board of
Examiners decides to grant this distinction and the following requirements have been met:

- The weighted average of the results of the courses in the BSc programme (150 ECTs) weighed on
the basis of the credits is at least 8.00, including the Bachelor Final project.

- The student completed all requirements for the degree within a period of time not exceeding 42
months.

awards.title: ASML Technology Scholarship
awards.description: Scholarship granted to a very selected group of 25 students with an outstanding performance during the Bachelor degree who aim at pursuing a Master's Degree in the field of Technology (e.g. engineering, physics, mathematics) in a Dutch University. The selection process consisted of of 3 rounds with a starting group of 270 candidates. The scholarship provides the student with a financial support of 10,000 euros, a two-year personal development program with coaching, training courses and workshops, and a personal mentor.

awards.title: Ladybird guide to spacecraft operations training course - Sponsorship
awards.description:
Full sponsorship for following a 4-day course in Redu (Belgium) about spacecraft operations.
Multiple topics are treated, among others are Orbit Control System, Power, Command and Control or Attitude Dynamic and Control Subsystems. The experience concluded with a group exercise dealing with a real spacecraft mission.

awards.title: Dynamics competition: 1st prize
awards.description: Best design of a Fowler flap mechanism and a mechanical arm out of 400 students, being awarded a copy of the Steam game “Kerbal Space Program” (KSP). The assignment involved intensive computations and 3D modelling with CATIA.

projects.title: Noise analysis of LADP and iADP applied to linearized F-16 aircraft
projects.description: Independent research project within the Control & Simulation group as part of the Master Honours Programme. Studying the application of Linear Approximate Dynamic Programming (LADP) and the iterative Approximate Dynamic Programming (iADP) methods to the linearized F-16 aircraft model, investigating what are the effects of noise and disturbances in the model, as well as researching potential methods to counteract their influence.

contributors.headline: Aerospace Research Engineer for SJSURF @ NASA Ames | TU Delft | Co-Founder 180DC Delft-Rotterdam | Holland in the Valley Fellow and ASML scholar
Assistant Professor at TUDelft
孙博｜PhD Candidate at TU Delft | Software Engineer at ING

projects.title: Moving towards hybrid-electric propulsion: design methodology and feasibility studies applied to a regional turboprop aircraft.
projects.description:
As part of the Honours Programme offered by the university of TUDelft for the Bachelor at the faculty of Aerospace Engineering, I dedicate my personal research project to the study of the hybrid aircraft and its performance, commenting its advantages and disadvantages in comparison with the conventional only-fuel counterpart.  The project has been mainly focused on the application of hybrid engines to propeller regional and business aircraft, due to the still immature capacity of today’s batteries for large commercial aircraft. 

Based on Roskam, a methodology for the design of hybrid-electric aircraft and the weight estimation of its propulsion system was developed. A Python tool has been devised for the application of the theory and the research outcomes to multiple configurations.

Project developed within the Flight Performance and Propulsion department under the supervision of Dr. Fabrizio Oliviero.

contributors.headline: Aerospace Research Engineer for SJSURF @ NASA Ames | TU Delft | Co-Founder 180DC Delft-Rotterdam | Holland in the Valley Fellow and ASML scholar
Lecturer at Delft University of Technology

projects.title: Silent Delivery Drone - Silentium
projects.description:
Final Bachelor Project aimed at the development of a delivery drone which meets the European noise regulations, while still being competitive with the options already available in the market. Major delivery companies such as DHL, UPS or Amazon have been developing during years small drones to deliver packages, an exciting alternative to truck delivery which is expected to start operating in the near future. Its advantages are its speed, sustainability and safety: a drone is not subjected to traffic, it can be electric and is more efficient than truck delivery. 

The project was carried out with other 9 students during the period of 11 weeks under the supervision of Dr. Francesco Avallone, Dr. Joost Ellerbroek and Eirini Tsiangou. Main tasks performed: 

• Participated in the project management and the project systems engineering
• Analysed and mitigated technical risk as the project's risk officer
• Performed first-class weight estimation and drone sizing
• Performed 2D and 3D aerodynamic analysis of drone's wings and fuselage
• Performed complete subsystem integration and stability analysis of the vehicle
• Developed CATIA model of the complete drone
• Designed final poster
• Presented the project results during the Aerospace Symposium

- I presented the project at the Unmanned Cargo Aircraft Conference on the 28th of November 2018 at RAI Amsterdam.
- The project summary was published in the Leonardo Times, October 2018 issue (http://leonardotimes.com/magazine/, page 42).

projects.title: Traffic jam prediction in Dutch road network
projects.description:
Project that aims at designing a model that predicts traffic jams in the Dutch road network by combining live traffic data and weather information.

Main tasks consisted of:
• Literature study of traffic theory and current research in the field.
• Extraction of traffic and weather data and conversion to desired format and file type.
• Design of machine learning algorithm that predicts the future traffic.
• Design of algorithm that predicts the future presence of traffic jam.
• Results and conclusions are orally presented and documented in technical report.

The project involved the intensive use of computational intelligence and big data tools.

contributors.headline: Aerospace Research Engineer for SJSURF @ NASA Ames | TU Delft | Co-Founder 180DC Delft-Rotterdam | Holland in the Valley Fellow and ASML scholar
Aerodynamicist || Aerospace Engineer || Technical consultant
Propulsion Development Engineer

projects.title: Analysis of flight delay patterns in Europe
projects.description:
Research project that aimed at studying the flight delay patterns in Europe under the supervision of Prof.  Bruno Santos at the faculty of Aerospace Engineering. The objective of the project was the adequate manipulation of the data in order to observe current patterns that may allow the prediction of delay propagation.

Main tasks consisted of:
• Performed thorough literature study in order to learn and understand the already existing information, as well as the tools required for the data analysis (probability studies and efficient clustering). 
• Exhaustive filtering of data provided by Eurocontrol.
• Analysis of trends, clustering and creation of prediction models with Python.
• Conclusions and results were orally defended and documented in a scientific report.

Team work, communication and management of resources were essential aptitudes.

projects.title: Business jet aerodynamic and structural design
projects.description:
The project was based on an iterative process for the design of the wing of a business jet and multiple aircraft subsystems from a series of initial constraints.

Main tasks consisted of:
• Carried out a literature study in order to fully understand the functionalitites and components of a wing.
• Trade-off and computation of design point in order to fulfill requirements.
• Design in detail of High Lift Devices (HLD), spoilers and ailerons.  
• Design of landing gear and shock absorbers. 
• The progress and results were orally presented and documented in technical reports.

The project strongly required leadership, team work, initiative and communication, as well as the constant use of Python, CATIA and LaTeX.

contributors.headline: Aerospace Research Engineer for SJSURF @ NASA Ames | TU Delft | Co-Founder 180DC Delft-Rotterdam | Holland in the Valley Fellow and ASML scholar
MSc student Aerodynamics at Delft University of Technology

projects.title: Small Rocket Project (SRP)
projects.description:
Within the DARE (Delft Aerospace Rocket Engineering) society a rocket was developed, designed and tested with the objective of launching an egg to an altitude of 1 km and returning it in a perfect condition. 

Rocky 1 consisted of: 
- body tube and fins made out of composites (glass fiber)
- a 3D printed cone and spring system designed with CATIA
- a self-sewed parachute
- electronics and servo for deployment
- self-designed EPU (Egg Protection Unit) made out of memory foam

The mission was accomplished with a successful result, the egg returned intact.

projects.title: Wing box design
projects.description:
The main goal of the project was the understanding of the importance of a wing box, and its design and manufacture by means of an iterative process.

Main tasks included:
• With the mechanics of materials knowledge, a trade-off and analysis of multiple concepts was performed. At the end, a design was selected, manufactured and tested.
• The process was iterated, optimizing the product which was able to resist bending and torsional loads.  
• Conclusions were orally presented and documented in a technical report.

projects.title: Flying wing project
projects.description:
The aim of the project was to design and manufacture a flying wing with the hypothetical mission of analyzing the Hellas Basin topography in Mars.

Main tasks consisted of:
• Performed trade-off between range and endurance of the vehicle.
• Performed aerodynamic analysis for the selection of the best airfoil and stability analysis in order to ease maneuverability.
• The flying wing was presented with a poster; and later it was built and tested.

Team work, efficiency and leadership were essential values that lead to a successful product.

profile_positions.title: Research Scholar - Aerospace Engineering Project Associate

profile_positions.description:
Developed and taught a six-week online course in the field of UAV's for future entrepreneurs. The program encompasses the business and technical aspects offered by this emerging technology. Three teaching modes were integrated in order to provide a comprehensive learning experience: 

1. online lectures
2. group projects which developed drone-based businesses in different sectors (security, inspection, agriculture, marketing and entertainment)
3. individual mentoring
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Assist the team during the quarterly international open days by presenting the AE faculty, university and city of Delft to future Freshmen; leading informative and educational tours, and one-to-one meetings. 

⇨Major strengths: Communication and presentation skills.
profile_positions.title: Aerospace recruitment team member

profile_positions.description: We are the Delft-Rotterdam branch of the world's largest university based consultancy, and the world's leading provider of consulting services for non-profits, social enterprises, and social-minded companies. We improve education, reduce homelessness and alleviate poverty by helping socially conscious organizations receive the support and expertise they need to improve and expand their services; exploiting the analytical, data science and practical tech/business skills of TU Delft and Erasmus University Rotterdam students. At the same time, we develop a generation of future leaders committed to making a difference.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & Consulting Director

profile_positions.description:
7 Aerospace Engineering and Computer Science courses:

• Apr 2020 – Jul 2020: Teaching assistant - AE1205 Programming & scientific computing in Python
• Sep 2018 – Nov 2018: Teaching Assistant - TI3105TU Introduction to Python Programming
• Sep 2018 – Nov 2018: Teaching Assistant - WB1641 Digital Skills Project

• Apr 2017 – Aug 2017: Teaching Assistant  - AE1205 Programming & scientific computing in Python

Main tasks:
• Answered student’s questions (6 courses with groups from 20 to 200 students).
• Participated in the proctoring and correction of the main and resit examinations.
• Suggestion of possible exam questions for the main exam, resit or future assignments.
• Acted as first point of contact and provided guidance and mentorship to 20 students.

⇨ Major strengths: mentoring, leadership, communication and presentation skills.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Participated in two projects:

• Carried out state estimation of FLEXOP demonstrator aircraft. The platform is envisioned to improve the wing efficiency by implementing passive and active flutter control.
• Designed, implemented and tested a novel robust automatic landing controller for over-weight landing. Its implementation would lead to a higher degree of safety, especially in the case that no fuel can be dumped. It avoids the dumping of fuel over land or sea, as well as the need of loitering in order to burn fuel, reducing the negative environmental impact.
• Performed controller gain parallelized multi-objective optimization with computer cluster in order to comply with Monte Carlo analysis certification requirements.

Internship at “CT Ingenieros Getafe” carrying out the buckling analysis of a Dutch Trailing Suction Hopper Dredger.

•	Development of Python code for calculations
•	Manipulation of data using Excel and Textpad
•	Obtaining stresses and dimensions from the ship’s FEM (Finite Element Model) working with Patran (engineering software)

profile_positions.title: Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
The European Robotics Forum will host its first hackathon in its 2022 Rotterdam edition. Named as "Battle of Institutions!", 9 Dutch universities will compete with teams of 5-8 students in a 3-day robotics hackathon. The students do not only have the opportunity of competing for great prizes in a full-fledged event packed with activities, but they will also have the chance of networking at the ERF, surrounded by academic and industry leaders in the sector.

Contributed to the following tasks:

• Search and acquisition of sponsors and challenge owners.
• Definition of hackathon challenges with challenge owners and stakeholders.
• Definition of hackathon concept, organisation timeline and schedule.

volunteer_experiences.role: Aerospace Engineering Honours Symposium Organizer and Moderator
volunteer_experiences.description: Organized and moderated the Aerospace Engineering Honours Symposium with guest speakers from ESA, AVY and McKinsey & Company and a budget of 5,000 euros. The event attracted +/- 125 guests, including members of the industry and academia.

Pilot initiative with the aim of linking Freshmen students to sophomore, junior and senior students. The objective is to provide experience and help the new members to adapt to the new culture and study pace.

This programme enhances the mentoring and communication skills of the volunteer.
Carried out multiple administrative tasks: www.peaceandcooperation.org
